description: Switched to it completely instead of installing Godot the normal way
summary: Best way to use Godot with multiple versions

description: Great app to keep multiple godot versions and projects in one place, but I'm not sure why it takes nearly a gig of storage.

I've been thinking for a while that Godot version management is annoying. Unity addresses the issue with their official Unity Hub app. Godot has nothing of the sort. Nothing official, that is. Godots replaces the official project selecter with a full-fledged launcher. Even if you're only using a single version of Godot, it's annoying to create desktop entries manually. Godots addresses that by shipping with one.

My only complaint is that it doesn't use Documents+FilePicker portals, but that's a limitation with Godot itself.

A pesar de ser una aplicación en Flatpak, que pensaba que tendría problemas al integrarse con el resto del sistema, hace su trabajo de forma genial.

Indexa, mantiene y descarga distintas versiones de Godot para distintos proyectos, permite lanzar el editor y trabajar directamente y facilita el uso del IDE.
